title: Executive Order 6239-Organization of Executive Agencies
content: Under the provisions of section 22 of Executive Order No. 6166, dated June 10, 1933, issued pursuant to section 16 of the act of March 3, 1933 (Public, No. 428, 47 Stat. 1517), the effective date for the abolition of the Federal Coordinating Service, as directed in section 17 of said Executive order, is deferred to October 10, 1933: Provided, That such abolition may be made effective, in whole or in part, between August 10, 1933, and October 10, 1933, by order of the President.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6239-Organization of Executive Agencies Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362059
